group_description: Policies, procedures, and technical mechanisms that govern who can access information systems, resources, and data, ensuring only authorized users, processes, or devices gain entry.
group_purpose: Prevent unauthorized access, enforce least privilege, protect system boundaries, and maintain confidentiality, integrity, and availability of resources.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, disseminate, and periodically review access control policies and procedures aligned with laws, regulations, and organizational risk.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal access control policy covering purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, and compliance requirements.
Develop and document procedures to implement the access control policy across systems and teams.
Assign an official responsible for managing access control policy and procedure lifecycle.
Review and update access control policy and procedures annually or after significant events.

controls.control_description: Define, document, approve, and regularly review user and system accounts to ensure only authorized individuals and services have access.

rules.text: Document all account types including user, service, privileged, temporary, and shared accounts.
Assign account managers responsible for overseeing user and system accounts.
Define and document conditions for group and role membership eligibility.
Specify authorized users, group membership, and access rights for every account.
rules.tool: AWS IAM, Azure AD, GCP IAM

rules.text: Require formal approval before creating any new user or service account.
Automate account creation, modification, disablement, and removal using approved procedures.
Enforce strong initial password requirements including length, complexity, and no defaults.
rules.tool: AWS IAM Policy, Azure AD Password Policy

rules.text: Limit concurrent sessions per account to prevent session hijacking.
rules.tool: AWS IAM Session Policy, Azure Conditional Access

rules.text: Automatically disable accounts with no activity for over 90 days.
Integrate HR offboarding to automatically disable accounts upon termination.
Review all accounts quarterly for necessity, access level, and compliance.
rules.tool: Prisma Cloud, AWS IAM Access Analyzer

rules.text: Prohibit shared accounts and enforce individual accountability.
Enforce session timeout after 15 minutes of inactivity on all consoles.
rules.tool: AWS Console, Azure Portal, GCP Console

controls.control_description: Automate account management tasks including creation, modification, review, disablement, and removal.

rules.text: Automate user account provisioning using identity federation and SCIM.
rules.tool: Okta, Azure AD Connect, AWS SSO

rules.text: Automate service account creation via infrastructure-as-code templates.

controls.control_description: Automatically remove or disable temporary and emergency accounts after a defined period.

rules.text: Set expiration dates on break-glass accounts and auto-disable after 24 hours.

controls.control_description: Disable accounts that have been inactive for a defined period.

rules.text: Disable user accounts inactive for 90 days using automated scripts.

controls.control_description: Automatically notify account managers when accounts are no longer required or users change roles.

rules.text: Send automated alerts to managers when user roles change in HR system.

controls.control_description: Require users to log out after a defined period of inactivity.

rules.text: Enforce 15-minute inactivity timeout on all interactive sessions.
rules.tool: AWS Console, Azure AD, GCP Console

controls.control_description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources using role-based or attribute-based access control.

rules.text: Deny all access by default and explicitly allow only approved actions via IAM policies.
rules.tool: AWS IAM, Azure RBAC, GCP IAM

rules.text: Use role-based access control to assign permissions based on job function.
Prevent privilege escalation by restricting IAM policy attachments.

controls.control_description: Control the flow of information between system components and external networks using firewalls, proxies, and data guards.

rules.text: Restrict inbound and outbound traffic using security groups and network ACLs.
Enforce data flow rules using VPC service controls and private endpoints.
Use network security groups to filter traffic between Azure subnets.

controls.control_description: Enforce separation of duties to prevent any single individual from performing conflicting security functions.

rules.text: Prevent the same user from both requesting and approving high-risk changes.
Enforce role mutual exclusivity for security administration and audit functions.

controls.control_description: Grant users, processes, and systems the minimum permissions necessary to perform their functions.

rules.text: Assign the most restrictive IAM policy that still allows required job functions.
Use just-in-time elevation for temporary privileged access.
Review and remove unused IAM permissions quarterly using access analyzer tools.
rules.tool: AWS IAM Access Analyzer, Prisma Cloud

controls.control_description: Explicitly authorize access to security functions and security-relevant information.

rules.text: Restrict access to IAM, KMS, and audit log management to authorized security admins.

controls.control_description: Require non-privileged accounts for nonsecurity functions even for privileged users.

rules.text: Require administrators to use standard user accounts for email and web browsing.

controls.control_description: Lock accounts after a defined number of consecutive failed login attempts to prevent brute-force attacks.

rules.text: Lock account for 15 minutes after 5 consecutive failed login attempts.
rules.tool: AWS IAM, Azure AD, GCP IAM

rules.text: Log all failed login attempts with source IP and timestamp for audit.
rules.tool: CloudTrail, Azure Monitor, GCP Audit Logs

controls.control_description: Display an approved system use notification message before granting access.

rules.text: Display legal banner warning of monitoring and consent to terms before login.
rules.tool: AWS SSM, Azure AD, GCP OS Login

controls.control_description: Prevent access to the system via a device lock after a period of inactivity.

rules.text: Enforce screen lock after 15 minutes of inactivity on all managed devices.

controls.control_description: Automatically terminate user sessions after a defined period of inactivity.

rules.text: Terminate idle SSH and RDP sessions after 10 minutes.

controls.control_title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
controls.control_description: Identify specific user actions that can be performed without identification or authentication.

rules.text: Allow public read access to marketing website but require auth for all admin functions.

controls.control_description: Authorize, monitor, and control remote access to the system using secure protocols and authentication.

rules.text: Require multi-factor authentication for all remote access sessions.
rules.tool: AWS Client VPN, Azure VPN, GCP IAP

rules.text: Route all remote traffic through a managed bastion host or VPN gateway.
Log and monitor all remote access sessions including user, time, and actions.

controls.control_description: Authorize, monitor, and control wireless access to the system.

rules.text: Require WPA3 encryption and 802.1X authentication for all corporate Wi-Fi.

controls.control_description: Establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for mobile devices.

rules.text: Enroll all mobile devices in MDM and enforce encryption and remote wipe.

controls.control_description: Establish terms and conditions for use of external systems and monitor compliance.

rules.text: Require DLP and CASB to monitor data sent to external SaaS applications.
rules.tool: Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps, Netskope

controls.control_description: Facilitate information sharing by enabling authorized users to determine access permissions.

rules.text: Allow document owners to grant share access with expiration and audit logging.

controls.control_description: Designate individuals authorized to post publicly accessible content and review content prior to posting.

rules.text: Require communications team approval before publishing content to public websites.

controls.control_description: Employ technical and procedural measures to prevent unauthorized data mining and protect sensitive patterns or relationships in organizational data.

rules.text: Apply differential privacy techniques to datasets before releasing for analytics to prevent re-identification.
rules.tool: Google DPF, OpenDP, AWS Clean Rooms

rules.text: Restrict access to raw transaction logs and require aggregation before analysis to prevent pattern inference.
Implement data masking and tokenization in non-production environments to prevent mining of sensitive correlations.

controls.control_description: Establish procedures to ensure access control decisions are made by authorized individuals or processes using defined criteria.

rules.text: Centralize all access control decisions in a policy engine using ABAC or ReBAC models.
rules.tool: OPA, Styra, Permify, AWS Verified Permissions

rules.text: Require dual authorization for access policy changes affecting privileged resources.
Log all access control decisions with context including requester, resource, and policy rule applied.
rules.tool: OPA Audit Logs, CloudTrail, Azure Monitor

controls.control_description: Implement a reference monitor that is tamper-resistant, always invoked, and small enough to be subject to analysis and testing.

rules.text: Enforce all access requests through cloud-native policy enforcement points that cannot be bypassed.
rules.tool: AWS IAM, Azure RBAC, GCP IAM, Istio

rules.text: Deploy service mesh sidecars to mediate all microservice traffic with mTLS and authorization.
Conduct regular security testing and code review of access enforcement logic to verify tamper resistance.

group_description: Programs and activities to ensure personnel are aware of security risks, trained on policies and procedures, and capable of protecting organizational information and systems.
group_purpose: Build a security-conscious workforce that understands threats, follows policy, and contributes to a culture of compliance and risk management.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and disseminate awareness and training policies and procedures aligned with organizational mission and risk strategy.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal security awareness and training policy covering scope, roles, responsibilities, and delivery methods.
Document procedures for developing, delivering, tracking, and updating security training programs.
Assign a training coordinator responsible for program oversight and compliance reporting.
Review and update awareness and training policy and procedures annually or after major incidents.

controls.control_description: Provide basic security awareness training to all users on recognizing threats, reporting incidents, and following security practices.

rules.text: Deliver mandatory annual security awareness training to all employees and contractors.
Include phishing simulations with real-time feedback and remedial training for failures.
Track training completion and send automated reminders for overdue users.
Provide new hire security training within 30 days of onboarding.
Distribute monthly security newsletters with current threats and best practices.

controls.control_description: Include practical exercises in awareness training to reinforce learning through simulated scenarios.

rules.text: Run quarterly phishing drills with randomized templates and track click rates.
Require users who fail simulations to complete targeted micro-learning modules.

controls.control_description: Include insider threat awareness as part of security training to help users recognize and report suspicious behavior.

rules.text: Train users to identify insider threat indicators like data hoarding or policy violations.
Provide anonymous reporting channels for suspected insider activity.

controls.control_description: Provide role-specific security training to personnel with significant security responsibilities.

rules.text: Deliver annual role-based training for system administrators on secure configuration and logging.
Train developers on secure coding, OWASP Top 10, and threat modeling.
Require privacy training for employees handling PII or PHI.
Track role-based training completion and enforce access denial for non-compliance.

controls.control_description: Provide training on physical and environmental security controls relevant to user roles.

rules.text: Train data center staff on access control, badge usage, and tailgating prevention.

controls.control_description: Document and maintain records of security awareness and role-based training completion.

rules.text: Retain training completion records for at least three years in a centralized LMS.
Generate quarterly training compliance reports for leadership and auditors.

group_description: Mechanisms to generate, collect, analyze, and protect audit records that track user and system activity for security, compliance, and incident response.
group_purpose: Enable detection of unauthorized actions, support forensic analysis, ensure non-repudiation, and meet regulatory audit requirements.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain audit and accountability policies and procedures aligned with organizational risk and regulatory requirements.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal audit and accountability policy defining scope, roles, event types, retention, and protection.
Document procedures for log collection, analysis, retention, and response to audit findings.
Assign an audit manager responsible for policy enforcement and compliance reporting.
Review and update audit policy and procedures annually or after significant incidents.

controls.control_description: Define and document which system events must be audited to meet security, compliance, and operational needs.

rules.text: Maintain a list of auditable events including login, privilege use, config changes, and data access.
Include NIST 800-92 event types: authentication, authorization, system changes, and failures.
Review and update auditable event list annually or after risk assessment changes.

controls.control_description: Ensure audit records contain sufficient information to support forensic analysis and accountability.

rules.text: Include in every audit record: user ID, event type, timestamp, source IP, outcome, and resource.
rules.tool: CloudTrail, Azure Monitor, GCP Audit Logs

rules.text: Enforce UTC timestamps and synchronized time across all systems using NTP.
Capture both success and failure outcomes for all auditable events.

controls.control_description: Allocate sufficient storage for audit records and configure warnings when capacity thresholds are approached.

rules.text: Allocate audit storage to support at least 12 months of log retention.
Alert when audit storage reaches 80% capacity with escalation at 90%.

controls.control_title: Response to Audit Logging Process Failures
controls.control_description: Detect and respond to audit system failures such as storage exhaustion, network issues, or log corruption.

rules.text: Alert immediately on audit system failure including log loss or ingestion errors.
Automatically switch to secondary log destination if primary fails.

controls.control_title: Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting
controls.control_description: Regularly review and analyze audit records to detect anomalies, incidents, and compliance issues.

rules.text: Ingest all audit logs into a central SIEM for correlation and analysis.
Review critical security events daily and generate weekly compliance reports.
Correlate logs across identity, network, and endpoint for threat detection.

controls.control_title: Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation
controls.control_description: Provide tools to reduce audit data and generate customized reports for different stakeholders.

rules.text: Filter and aggregate raw logs to reduce noise before storage and analysis.
Generate role-based audit reports: executive summary, compliance, and technical detail.

controls.control_description: Use internal system clocks synchronized to an authoritative time source for audit record timestamps.

rules.text: Synchronize all system clocks to NTP servers with stratum 3 or better.
Record timestamps in UTC with millisecond precision in all audit logs.

controls.control_description: Protect audit information and tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

rules.text: Restrict audit log access to authorized security analysts and auditors only.
Enable object-level immutability and write-once storage for audit logs.
rules.tool: S3 Object Lock, Azure Immutable Blob

rules.text: Encrypt audit logs at rest and in transit using AES-256.

controls.control_description: Provide mechanisms to prove actions were performed by specific users and prevent denial of actions.

rules.text: Capture user identity and action in immutable audit trails with cryptographic binding.
Use digital signatures on configuration changes in GitOps workflows.

controls.control_description: Retain audit records for a defined period to support after-the-fact investigations and compliance.

rules.text: Retain audit records for at least 12 months online and 7 years archived.
Automate log lifecycle with retention policies and secure deletion after expiry.

controls.control_description: Generate audit records for defined events using automated mechanisms across the system.

rules.text: Enable full audit logging on all cloud accounts, workloads, and applications.
rules.tool: AWS CloudTrail, Azure Activity Log, GCP Audit

rules.text: Deploy agents to capture OS and application logs from on-prem and container environments.
Validate audit record generation with daily health checks and coverage reports.

controls.control_description: Monitor systems for unauthorized export of information and alert on suspicious activity.

rules.text: Monitor for large data downloads, email attachments, and cloud sync events.

controls.control_description: Capture user session activity for privileged accounts to enable review and replay.

rules.text: Record all administrative SSH, RDP, and console sessions with full keystroke and video.
rules.tool: AWS SSM Session Manager, Teleport, ObserveIT

rules.text: Index session recordings for search and replay during investigations.

controls.control_description: Provide an alternate audit capability in the event of primary audit system failure.

rules.text: Replicate critical audit logs to a secondary region or cloud provider.

controls.control_description: Enable sharing of audit information with authorized external organizations when required.

rules.text: Establish secure log-sharing agreements and channels with partners and regulators.

group_description: Processes to assess security controls, authorize system operation, and continuously monitor effectiveness to maintain risk-based security posture.
group_purpose: Ensure systems are secure before go-live, maintain authorization through ongoing monitoring, and support risk-informed decision-making.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain assessment, authorization, and monitoring policies and procedures aligned with organizational risk strategy.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal security assessment and authorization policy covering scope, roles, and frequency.
Document procedures for control assessments, POA&M management, and continuous monitoring.
Assign a security assessment lead responsible for program execution and reporting.
Review and update assessment policy and procedures annually or after major changes.

controls.control_description: Assess security and privacy controls for effectiveness using defined methods and frequency.

rules.text: Conduct annual security control assessments using NIST 800-53A assessment procedures.
Document assessment results including findings, evidence, and remediation plans.
Track all assessment findings in a centralized POA&M register.

controls.control_description: Employ independent assessors or teams to conduct control assessments.

rules.text: Engage external assessors for FedRAMP, CMMC, or high-impact system assessments.

controls.control_description: Approve and manage connections to external systems and monitor for security compliance.

rules.text: Document all system interconnections in an Interconnection Security Agreement (ISA).
Review and reauthorize interconnections annually or after significant changes.

controls.control_description: Develop and maintain a POA&M to track and remediate security weaknesses.

rules.text: Create POA&M entries for all assessment findings with owner, timeline, and status.
Review POA&M status monthly and escalate overdue items to leadership.

controls.control_description: Authorize system operation based on risk determination and acceptance by senior officials.

rules.text: Issue formal Authorization to Operate (ATO) signed by Authorizing Official (AO).
Define ATO conditions including duration, scope, and monitoring requirements.

controls.control_description: Continuously monitor security controls and environment to detect changes and threats.

rules.text: Implement automated control monitoring using cloud-native and third-party tools.
rules.tool: AWS Config, Azure Policy, Prisma Cloud

rules.text: Generate monthly continuous monitoring reports with control status and trends.
Reassess high-risk controls quarterly and low-risk annually.

controls.control_description: Employ independent assessors to monitor control effectiveness on an ongoing basis.

rules.text: Engage external team to validate continuous monitoring results quarterly.

controls.control_description: Conduct penetration testing to identify exploitable vulnerabilities in the system.

rules.text: Perform annual penetration testing by qualified external red team.
Include scope, rules of engagement, and remediation tracking in pentest plan.

controls.control_description: Use independent penetration testers not involved in system development or operation.

rules.text: Contract third-party penetration testing firm with no prior system access.

controls.control_description: Authorize and document internal connections between system components.

rules.text: Maintain architecture diagram and data flow documentation for all internal connections.
Review internal connection approvals during change management process.

group_description: Policies and processes to establish, document, and maintain secure system configurations throughout the lifecycle.
group_purpose: Prevent unauthorized changes, enforce secure baselines, detect drift, and support audit and recovery.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain configuration management policies and procedures aligned with risk strategy.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal configuration management policy defining scope, roles, and change processes.
Document procedures for baseline creation, change approval, and drift remediation.
Assign a configuration manager responsible for policy enforcement and compliance.
Review and update CM policy and procedures annually or after major incidents.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain secure baseline configurations for all systems and components.

rules.text: Maintain approved baseline configurations for OS, applications, and cloud resources.
Use infrastructure-as-code to define and version-control all baselines.
Review and update baselines annually or after vulnerability disclosure.

controls.control_description: Establish and manage a formal change control process to evaluate, approve, and track configuration changes.

rules.text: Require formal change request with business justification and risk assessment.
Route high-risk changes through CAB for multi-stakeholder approval.
Log all approved changes with timestamp, approver, and rollback plan.

controls.control_description: Analyze proposed changes to determine security and operational impact before implementation.

rules.text: Assess each change for impact on security controls, dependencies, and compliance.

controls.control_description: Restrict configuration changes to authorized personnel and enforce separation of duties.

rules.text: Limit configuration access to approved roles via RBAC and just-in-time elevation.
rules.tool: AWS IAM, Azure PIM, GCP IAM

rules.text: Enforce dual approval for changes to production baselines or privileged systems.

controls.control_description: Establish and enforce mandatory configuration settings for systems and software.

rules.text: Enforce CIS or vendor hardening benchmarks on all systems via policy-as-code.
rules.tool: AWS Config Rules, Azure Policy, OpenSCAP

rules.text: Block non-compliant configurations using admission controllers and guardrails.

controls.control_description: Configure systems to provide only essential capabilities and prohibit unnecessary functions.

rules.text: Disable unnecessary services, ports, protocols, and software by default.
Require business justification to enable any non-standard service or port.

controls.control_description: Develop and maintain an inventory of system components including hardware, software, and firmware.

rules.text: Maintain real-time inventory of all cloud and on-prem assets with owner and purpose.
rules.tool: AWS Systems Manager, ServiceNow CMDB, Prisma

rules.text: Reconcile inventory weekly and investigate unauthorized assets immediately.

controls.control_description: Develop and implement a configuration management plan that addresses roles, responsibilities, and processes.

rules.text: Document CM plan including tools, workflows, baselines, and compliance reporting.

controls.control_description: Establish and enforce restrictions on software installation and use.

rules.text: Allow only approved software via application allowlisting and block all else.

controls.control_description: Prohibit or strictly control user-installed software on organizational systems.

rules.text: Block local admin rights and monitor for unauthorized software installation.

controls.control_description: Identify and document the location of information and system components.

rules.text: Tag all data and compute resources with location, sensitivity, and owner.
rules.tool: AWS Tags, Azure Tags, GCP Labels

controls.control_description: Map data actions (create, read, update, delete) to security controls and monitor compliance.

rules.text: Document CRUD operations for all data types and link to access controls.
Enforce data action policies via ABAC in applications and databases.

controls.control_description: Require cryptographic signatures on software, firmware, and configuration files.

rules.text: Enforce container image signing and verify before deployment.
Sign all IaC templates and scripts with GPG or code signing certs.

group_description: Establish, maintain, and test plans and procedures to ensure continuity of critical operations during and after disruptions.
group_purpose: Minimize impact of outages, enable rapid recovery, and protect essential functions through proactive planning and testing.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain contingency planning policies and procedures aligned with organizational risk tolerance.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal contingency planning policy defining scope, roles, and RTO/RPO targets.
Document procedures for plan development, testing, training, and revision.
Assign a contingency planning coordinator responsible for program oversight.
Review and update CP policy and procedures annually or after major incidents.

controls.control_description: Develop and document a contingency plan for system recovery and continued operations during disruptions.

rules.text: Create a contingency plan with recovery objectives, roles, procedures, and communication protocols.
Include alternate processing sites, data restoration, and manual procedures in the plan.
Distribute the contingency plan to all recovery personnel and store offsite.

controls.control_description: Train personnel on contingency roles and responsibilities to ensure effective plan execution.

rules.text: Conduct annual contingency training for all recovery team members.
Include tabletop exercises simulating outages, ransomware, and site failure.

controls.control_description: Test the contingency plan to validate recovery procedures and identify deficiencies.

rules.text: Conduct annual full contingency plan testing including failover and recovery.
Document test results, lessons learned, and update plan within 30 days.
Test backup restoration quarterly from alternate storage locations.

controls.control_description: Establish an alternate storage site with backups sufficient to meet RPO requirements.

rules.text: Store encrypted backups in a geographically separate region or third-party vault.
Ensure alternate site is not subject to the same threats as primary.

controls.control_description: Establish an alternate processing site capable of resuming operations within RTO.

rules.text: Maintain a hot or warm alternate site with replicated infrastructure and data.
Test failover to alternate site annually with full cutover and cutback.

controls.control_description: Establish alternate telecommunications services to support critical functions during primary failure.

rules.text: Contract with two or more ISPs with automatic failover routing.

controls.control_description: Conduct regular backups of system data, configurations, and software to support recovery.

rules.text: Perform daily incremental and weekly full backups of all critical data and systems.
Enable versioned backups with 30-day retention and immutability.
Encrypt all backups at rest and in transit using customer-managed keys.

controls.control_description: Provide mechanisms to recover and reconstitute the system to a known secure state after disruption.

rules.text: Automate system recovery using infrastructure-as-code and immutable images.
Validate recovered systems match approved baseline before returning to production.

controls.control_description: Provide alternate communication protocols to support resilience during primary protocol failure.

rules.text: Support multiple network protocols and automatic failover between them.

controls.control_description: Provide capability to boot system into a secure, restricted safe mode for recovery.

rules.text: Enable secure boot and safe mode with minimal services for emergency recovery.

controls.control_description: Employ alternative or supplemental security mechanisms when primary controls fail.

rules.text: Implement manual approval workflows when automated access controls fail.

group_description: Processes and mechanisms to uniquely identify and authenticate users, devices, and services before granting access.
group_purpose: Prevent unauthorized access, enforce accountability, and support secure identity lifecycle management.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain identification and authentication policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal identity and authentication policy defining scope, standards, and enforcement.
Document procedures for user provisioning, password management, and authenticator lifecycle.
Assign an identity management lead responsible for policy compliance and reporting.
Review and update IA policy and procedures annually or after incidents.

controls.control_description: Uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users using strong, risk-based methods.

rules.text: Require multi-factor authentication (MFA) for all interactive user logins.
Enforce single sign-on (SSO) using SAML or OIDC for all cloud applications.
Block legacy authentication protocols (POP, IMAP, SMTP without MFA).

controls.control_description: Require MFA for all privileged and administrative account access.

rules.text: Enforce hardware-based or phishing-resistant MFA for all admin accounts.

controls.control_description: Use PIV or CAC credentials for high-security federal systems.

rules.text: Issue and enforce PIV cards for all federal employees and contractors.

controls.control_description: Uniquely identify and authenticate devices before allowing network access.

rules.text: Issue X.509 certificates to all managed devices for mutual TLS authentication.
rules.tool: AWS PCA, Azure AD Cert Auth, Venafi

rules.text: Enforce 802.1X authentication for wired and Wi-Fi network access.

controls.control_description: Manage user identifiers by creating, issuing, and deactivating accounts.

rules.text: Assign unique identifiers to all users and disable generic or shared accounts.
Automate user provisioning and deprovisioning via SCIM from HRIS.

controls.control_description: Manage authenticators including passwords, tokens, and biometrics.

rules.text: Enforce password complexity: 12+ chars, no reuse, no common words.
Require passwordless or phishing-resistant MFA (FIDO2, Passkeys).
Rotate service account keys and certificates every 90 days.
Store password hashes using Argon2, bcrypt, or PBKDF2 with high iterations.

controls.control_description: Enforce strong password policies and protect credentials in storage and transit.

rules.text: Block passwords found in known breach databases (HIBP integration).
rules.tool: Okta, Azure AD, Pwned Passwords API

rules.text: Require password change on first login and after suspected compromise.

controls.control_description: Obscure feedback of authentication information during the process.

rules.text: Mask password input with dots or asterisks in all login interfaces.

controls.control_description: Enforce FIPS 140-validated cryptographic modules for authentication.

rules.text: Use only FIPS 140-2/3 validated modules for all cryptographic operations.
rules.tool: AWS KMS, Azure Key Vault, OpenSSL FIPS

controls.control_description: Uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users (public, partners).

rules.text: Authenticate external users via federated identity or secure guest portals.

controls.control_description: Uniquely identify and authenticate services and applications.

rules.text: Authenticate service-to-service calls using mTLS or signed JWTs.

controls.control_description: Use risk-based authentication that adapts to context and behavior.

rules.text: Trigger step-up authentication for high-risk actions or anomalous behavior.
rules.tool: Okta Risk Signals, Azure AD Identity Protection

controls.control_description: Require re-authentication for sensitive actions or after inactivity.

rules.text: Require re-authentication for privilege escalation or PII access.

controls.control_description: Verify the identity of users before issuing credentials.

rules.text: Perform identity proofing for high-assurance accounts using IAL2/3 processes.

group_description: Processes and capabilities to prepare for, detect, analyze, contain, eradicate, recover from, and learn from cybersecurity incidents.
group_purpose: Minimize impact of incidents, enable rapid recovery, and improve defenses through lessons learned.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain incident response policies and procedures aligned with organizational risk.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal incident response policy defining scope, roles, and escalation paths.
Document procedures for detection, analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.
Assign an incident response lead and define on-call rotation schedule.
Review and update IR policy and procedures annually or after major incidents.

controls.control_description: Train personnel on incident response roles, procedures, and tools.

rules.text: Conduct annual incident response training for all IR team members.
Run quarterly tabletop exercises simulating ransomware, data breach, and DDoS.

controls.control_description: Test incident response capabilities to validate effectiveness and identify gaps.

rules.text: Conduct annual full-scale IR exercise with simulated breach and recovery.
Document test results and update IR plan within 30 days of exercise.

controls.control_description: Implement processes to contain, eradicate, and recover from incidents.

rules.text: Maintain incident playbooks for high-impact scenarios: ransomware, insider threat, DDoS.
Isolate compromised systems within 15 minutes of confirmed breach.
rules.tool: SOAR, AWS Network ACL, Azure NSG

rules.text: Restore systems from known-good backups after full malware eradication.

controls.control_description: Track and document incident information throughout the lifecycle.

rules.text: Log all incident activities in a centralized ticketing system with timestamps.

controls.control_description: Report incidents to designated authorities and stakeholders in required timeframes.

rules.text: Report PII breaches to US-CERT within 1 hour and affected individuals within 72 hours.
Notify executive leadership and legal within 1 hour of confirmed major incident.

controls.control_description: Provide support resources and expertise to assist in incident response.

rules.text: Maintain 24/7 access to internal SOC or third-party IR retainer services.
Engage external IR firm within 4 hours of declared major incident.

controls.control_description: Develop and maintain a comprehensive incident response plan.

rules.text: Document IR plan with roles, communication channels, tools, and recovery strategies.
Distribute IR plan to all stakeholders and store securely offsite.

controls.control_description: Respond to information spills by containing, documenting, and notifying affected parties.

rules.text: Isolate systems with spilled data and notify data owners within 1 hour.
Purge or sanitize spilled data and document cleanup actions.

controls.control_description: Enable secure information sharing during incident response with trusted partners.

rules.text: Share IOCs and TTPs with ISACs and trusted partners via secure channels.

group_description: Policies and processes to manage, perform, and document maintenance on systems and components to ensure availability, integrity, and security.
group_purpose: Minimize downtime, prevent failures, ensure secure maintenance practices, and maintain system reliability.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain system maintenance policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal system maintenance policy defining scope, roles, and approval processes.
Document procedures for scheduled, unscheduled, and remote maintenance activities.
Assign a maintenance coordinator responsible for oversight and compliance.
Review and update maintenance policy annually or after significant changes.

controls.control_description: Schedule, document, and approve maintenance activities to minimize operational impact.

rules.text: Require formal approval for all maintenance via change management process.
Log all maintenance actions with start/end time, personnel, and outcome.
Conduct post-maintenance validation to confirm system integrity and functionality.

controls.control_description: Approve, control, and monitor the use of maintenance tools and diagnostic equipment.

rules.text: Maintain an approved list of maintenance tools and scan for integrity before use.
Log all use of maintenance tools with user, time, and system accessed.

controls.control_description: Approve, control, and monitor nonlocal (remote) maintenance and diagnostic activities.

rules.text: Require MFA and just-in-time access for all remote maintenance sessions.
Record and retain all remote maintenance sessions for 12 months.
rules.tool: AWS Session Manager, ObserveIT, GCP Audit

rules.text: Terminate remote sessions after 30 minutes of inactivity.

controls.control_description: Establish and maintain a list of authorized maintenance personnel and monitor their actions.

rules.text: Maintain a current list of authorized maintenance personnel with roles and access levels.
Require background checks and NDAs for all third-party maintenance providers.

controls.control_description: Obtain maintenance support and spare parts within required timeframes to meet availability objectives.

rules.text: Establish SLAs with vendors for critical hardware support within 4 hours.
Maintain on-site or regional spare parts inventory for critical components.

controls.control_description: Restrict and monitor field maintenance to authorized personnel and locations.

rules.text: Require escorted access and logging for all on-site field maintenance.

group_description: Policies and safeguards to protect digital and physical media containing sensitive information throughout its lifecycle.
group_purpose: Prevent unauthorized disclosure, ensure proper handling, sanitization, and disposal of media to maintain confidentiality and integrity.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain media protection policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal media protection policy covering access, marking, storage, and disposal.
Document procedures for media sanitization, transport, and destruction.
Assign a media protection officer responsible for compliance and training.
Review and update media protection policy annually or after incidents.

controls.control_description: Restrict access to media containing sensitive information to authorized individuals.

rules.text: Store all sensitive media in locked cabinets or encrypted containers with access logs.
Require dual control for access to backup tapes or high-sensitivity media.

controls.control_description: Mark media with sensitivity labels to indicate handling and distribution limitations.

rules.text: Apply physical labels (e.g., CUI, Confidential) to all removable media and containers.
Embed classification metadata in digital files and enforce via DLP.

controls.control_description: Securely store media in controlled areas with environmental and physical protections.

rules.text: Store backup media in fire-rated, access-controlled offsite facility.
Encrypt all stored media at rest using AES-256 with customer-managed keys.
rules.tool: AWS KMS, Azure Key Vault, VeraCrypt

controls.control_description: Protect media during transport using encryption, tracking, and secure couriers.

rules.text: Use tamper-evident packaging and tracked couriers (FedEx, Iron Mountain) for media transport.
Encrypt media in transit and require signature confirmation upon receipt.
rules.tool: BitLocker To Go, AWS Snowball Edge

rules.text: Log chain of custody with sender, recipient, and timestamps.

controls.control_description: Sanitize media prior to disposal, release, or reuse using approved methods.

rules.text: Use NIST 800-88 clearing, purging, or destruction based on media type and sensitivity.
Verify sanitization success and issue certificate of destruction.

controls.control_description: Restrict the use of removable media and prohibit use of unapproved devices.

rules.text: Block all unauthorized USB storage devices via endpoint policy.
Allow only encrypted, corporate-issued removable media with unique IDs.

controls.control_description: Downgrade media to lower sensitivity level using approved sanitization and re-labeling.

rules.text: Sanitize and re-label media before downgrading from Secret to CUI or Unclassified.

group_description: Safeguards to protect systems, buildings, and supporting infrastructure from physical threats and environmental hazards.
group_purpose: Prevent unauthorized physical access, damage, and interference to maintain availability and integrity of information systems.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain physical and environmental protection policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal physical and environmental protection policy defining scope, roles, and controls.
Document procedures for access control, visitor management, and emergency response.
Assign a physical security officer responsible for compliance and incident response.
Review and update physical protection policy annually or after incidents.

controls.control_description: Authorize and maintain physical access to facilities and systems for approved individuals.

rules.text: Maintain an approved access list for all data centers and server rooms with role-based permissions.
Remove physical access within 24 hours of employee termination or role change.

controls.control_description: Enforce physical access controls using locks, guards, badges, and authentication mechanisms.

rules.text: Require badge + PIN or biometric for entry to all restricted areas.
Deploy mantraps or turnstiles at data center entrances to prevent tailgating.
Log all physical access events with user, time, and location.

controls.control_description: Control physical access to information system distribution and transmission lines.

rules.text: Route all network cabling through locked conduits or secured raceways.

controls.control_description: Control physical access to information system output devices to prevent unauthorized use.

rules.text: Require secure print release with badge or PIN at shared printers.

controls.control_description: Monitor physical access to facilities and review logs for anomalies.

rules.text: Deploy 24/7 CCTV with 90-day retention covering all entry/exit points and server rooms.
Alert on unauthorized access attempts or access outside business hours.

controls.control_description: Control physical access by visitors and maintain visitor logs.

rules.text: Issue temporary visitor badges and require escort in restricted areas.
Log all visitor entries with name, purpose, sponsor, and time in/out.

controls.control_description: Protect power equipment and cabling from damage and unauthorized access.

rules.text: Secure UPS, PDUs, and generators in locked rooms with restricted access.

controls.control_description: Provide emergency power shutoff capability to protect systems during incidents.

rules.text: Install labeled EPO switches near exits in data centers with protected covers.

controls.control_description: Provide short-term backup power to support orderly shutdown or continued operation.

rules.text: Deploy UPS with at least 15 minutes runtime for critical systems and graceful shutdown.

controls.control_description: Provide emergency lighting for safe evacuation and system access during power failure.

rules.text: Install battery-backed emergency lighting in data centers and egress paths.

controls.control_description: Employ fire detection and suppression systems appropriate for IT environments.

rules.text: Install VESDA and clean-agent (FM-200) suppression in all data centers.
Test fire detection and suppression systems quarterly with documented results.

controls.control_description: Maintain temperature and humidity within acceptable ranges for system reliability.

rules.text: Monitor data center temperature (18-27°C) and humidity (40-60%) with real-time alerts.

controls.control_description: Protect systems from water damage due to leaks, floods, or condensation.

rules.text: Install raised floors and water leak detection sensors under server racks.

controls.control_description: Control physical access for delivery and removal of system components.

rules.text: Log and inspect all incoming/outgoing hardware with serial numbers and approval.

controls.control_description: Employ security controls at alternate work sites comparable to primary sites.

rules.text: Require VPN, endpoint protection, and locked storage for remote workers handling CUI.

controls.control_description: Position system components to minimize exposure to physical and environmental hazards.

rules.text: Avoid placing servers near windows, exterior walls, or under water pipes.

group_description: Processes to develop, document, and maintain security and privacy plans that guide risk-based protection of systems and information.
group_purpose: Align security and privacy efforts with organizational mission, establish baselines, and enable consistent implementation across the enterprise.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain planning policies and procedures for security and privacy.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal planning policy defining scope, roles, and plan development processes.
Document procedures for system security plans, privacy plans, and architecture reviews.
Assign a planning coordinator responsible for policy enforcement and plan approval.
Review and update planning policy annually or after major organizational changes.

controls.control_description: Develop and maintain security and privacy plans for each system describing controls and responsibilities.

rules.text: Create a system security plan (SSP) for every in-scope system with boundary, controls, and roles.
Include privacy impact assessment (PIA) and data flow in the system plan.
Review and update SSP annually or after significant changes.

controls.control_description: Establish and provide rules of behavior for users of systems and information.

rules.text: Require all users to sign rules of behavior before granting system access.
Include expectations for password use, data handling, and incident reporting in rules.
Review and re-sign rules of behavior annually or after policy updates.

controls.control_description: Develop and maintain enterprise architecture with security and privacy by design.

rules.text: Document enterprise security architecture with network zones, data flows, and control points.
Align architecture to zero trust principles: identity, least privilege, microsegmentation.
Review architecture annually and after major technology or threat changes.

controls.control_description: Centrally manage planning processes and tools to ensure consistency and efficiency.

rules.text: Use a centralized GRC platform to manage all SSPs, policies, and control evidence.

controls.control_description: Select and document security and privacy control baselines tailored to system risk.

rules.text: Assign NIST 800-53 Low, Moderate, or High baseline based on FIPS 199 categorization.
Apply overlays (e.g., Cloud, IoT, Privacy) to modify baseline for specific technologies.

controls.control_description: Tailor selected baselines by adding, removing, or parameterizing controls based on risk.

rules.text: Document all tailoring decisions with risk-based justification and compensating controls.

group_description: Policies and processes to ensure individuals in trusted positions are screened, trained, and monitored to protect information and systems.
group_purpose: Reduce insider threats, enforce accountability, and maintain trust through lifecycle management of personnel security.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain personnel security policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal personnel security policy defining screening, access, and termination processes.
Document procedures for background checks, access agreements, and offboarding.
Assign a personnel security officer responsible for program oversight and compliance.
Review and update personnel security policy annually or after incidents.

controls.control_description: Assign risk levels to all positions based on duties and access to sensitive information.

rules.text: Classify all positions as Low, Moderate, or High risk based on access and impact.
Review position risk designations annually or after role changes.

controls.control_description: Screen individuals prior to granting access, commensurate with position risk.

rules.text: Conduct background checks (criminal, credit, reference) for all Moderate and High-risk positions.
Require fingerprinting and FBI check for High-risk or privileged access roles.
Rescreen personnel in High-risk positions every 5 years.

controls.control_description: Execute termination procedures to disable access and retrieve assets upon separation.

rules.text: Disable all system access within 1 hour of termination notification.
Retrieve all company assets (laptop, badge, tokens) on last day via checklist.
Conduct exit interview and remind of NDA and data protection obligations.

controls.control_description: Review and adjust access upon internal transfer or role change.

rules.text: Review and modify access privileges within 24 hours of role transfer.

controls.control_description: Require personnel to sign access agreements including NDA and rules of behavior.

rules.text: Require signed NDA and acceptable use agreement before granting system access.
Renew access agreements annually or upon policy update.

controls.control_description: Apply equivalent security requirements to contractors, vendors, and third-party personnel.

rules.text: Include personnel screening and access agreement clauses in all third-party contracts.
Verify contractor background checks and maintain evidence in vendor file.

controls.control_description: Establish and enforce sanctions for personnel failing to comply with security policies.

rules.text: Define progressive disciplinary actions for policy violations in employee handbook.
Track and report all security violations with remediation and sanctions applied.

group_description: Policies and controls to ensure personally identifiable information (PII) is collected, used, disclosed, and retained lawfully and transparently.
group_purpose: Protect individual privacy, enable informed consent, and provide visibility into PII processing activities.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain policies and procedures for PII processing and transparency.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal PII processing and transparency policy aligned with privacy laws.
Document procedures for privacy notices, consent, data subject requests, and PII inventory.
Assign a privacy officer responsible for PII compliance and transparency reporting.
Review and update PII policy annually or after regulatory changes.

controls.control_description: Identify and document legal authority for each PII processing activity.

rules.text: Document legal basis (consent, contract, legal obligation) for every PII collection and use.
Publish System of Records Notice (SORN) for federal systems processing PII.

controls.control_description: Specify and document purposes for PII processing and restrict use to those purposes.

rules.text: Define and document specific, explicit purposes for each PII processing activity.
Enforce purpose-based access controls to prevent unauthorized PII use.

controls.control_description: Obtain and manage individual consent for PII processing where required.

rules.text: Implement granular opt-in consent banners for cookies and marketing PII use.
Allow data subjects to withdraw consent at any time with immediate effect.
Log all consent actions with timestamp, user ID, and version of notice.

controls.control_description: Provide individuals with clear, accessible privacy notices at or before PII collection.

rules.text: Display just-in-time privacy notice at every PII collection point (forms, apps, websites).
Publish comprehensive privacy policy with data use, sharing, and rights.

controls.control_description: Develop and publish SORNs for systems maintaining PII retrievable by personal identifier.

rules.text: Publish SORN in Federal Register for each Privacy Act system of records.

controls.control_description: Establish processes to respond to individual requests regarding their PII.

rules.text: Provide self-service portal for data subjects to access, correct, or delete their PII.
Respond to DSARs within 30 days with verification and fulfillment tracking.

controls.control_description: Provide notice when conducting computer matching of PII with external sources.

rules.text: Publish computer matching agreement and notice in Federal Register before matching PII.

group_description: Processes to identify, assess, and prioritize risks to organizational operations, assets, individuals, and other organizations.
group_purpose: Enable informed risk-based decisions, allocate resources effectively, and maintain acceptable risk posture.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain risk assessment policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal risk assessment policy defining methodology, roles, and frequency.
Document procedures for threat modeling, vulnerability scanning, and risk prioritization.
Assign a risk management lead responsible for assessment oversight and reporting.
Review and update risk assessment policy annually or after major changes.

controls.control_description: Categorize systems and information based on impact of loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability.

rules.text: Assign FIPS 199 Low, Moderate, or High impact level to every system using impact analysis.
Review system categorizations annually or after scope or data changes.

controls.control_description: Conduct risk assessments to identify threats, vulnerabilities, likelihood, and impact.

rules.text: Perform annual risk assessment using NIST 800-30 methodology across all in-scope systems.
Conduct threat modeling for new systems and major changes before production.
Maintain a risk register with risk ID, score, owner, and mitigation status.

controls.control_description: Scan for vulnerabilities in systems and applications, prioritize, and remediate.

rules.text: Run authenticated vulnerability scans monthly on all in-scope assets.
Remediate critical vulnerabilities within 15 days and high within 30 days.
Subscribe to CVE feeds and threat intelligence for emerging risks.

controls.control_description: Respond to risk findings by accepting, avoiding, mitigating, or transferring risk.

rules.text: Assign risk owner and response strategy (mitigate, accept, transfer, avoid) for each high risk.
Require formal risk acceptance by authorizing official for residual risks.

controls.control_description: Assess privacy risks for systems processing PII and implement mitigations.

rules.text: Complete Privacy Impact Assessment (PIA) for all systems collecting or processing PII.
Update PIA before major system changes or every 3 years.

controls.control_description: Identify critical system components and functions to prioritize protection and recovery.

rules.text: Perform Business Impact Analysis (BIA) to define RTO, RPO, and criticality tiers.

controls.control_description: Proactively search for advanced threats and anomalies not detected by automated tools.

rules.text: Execute quarterly threat hunting exercises using MITRE ATT&CK and hypothesis-driven methods.

group_description: Policies and processes to ensure acquired systems, components, and services meet security and privacy requirements throughout the lifecycle.
group_purpose: Embed security early in procurement, development, and outsourcing to reduce risk, cost, and technical debt.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain system and services acquisition policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal acquisition policy defining security requirements in contracts and RFPs.
Document procedures for supplier assessment, secure development, and contract monitoring.
Assign an acquisition security lead responsible for compliance and risk review.
Review and update acquisition policy annually or after regulatory changes.

controls.control_description: Allocate sufficient resources to implement security and privacy in system acquisition and development.

rules.text: Include security and privacy resource needs in project budgets and staffing plans.

controls.control_description: Manage system development using a secure SDLC with integrated security activities.

rules.text: Adopt a secure SDLC framework (e.g., NIST 800-160, OWASP SAMM) with security gates.
Require threat modeling, SAST, and DAST in development and pre-production phases.

controls.control_description: Include security and privacy requirements in acquisition contracts and agreements.

rules.text: Embed NIST 800-53 controls and SLAs in all RFPs and contracts for systems and services.
Require suppliers to provide evidence of secure development and testing (e.g., SOC 2, penetration test).

controls.control_description: Apply security and privacy engineering principles in system design and development.

rules.text: Enforce least privilege, secure defaults, and defense in depth in all system designs.

controls.control_description: Require external providers to comply with organizational security and privacy requirements.

rules.text: Conduct security and privacy risk assessment before engaging any external service provider.
Include right-to-audit and data protection clauses in all cloud and SaaS contracts.

controls.control_description: Require developers to implement configuration management for systems under development.

rules.text: Mandate Git-based version control and IaC for all code and infrastructure changes.

controls.control_description: Require developers to perform security and privacy testing during development.

rules.text: Integrate SAST, SCA, and DAST into CI/CD pipelines with automated failure on high issues.
Require independent penetration testing before production deployment.
rules.tool: External Pen Test Firm, Bug Bounty

controls.control_description: Define and enforce secure development processes, standards, and tools.

rules.text: Standardize secure toolchain: IDE, linters, package managers, and container base images.

controls.control_description: Require developers to complete secure coding and privacy training.

rules.text: Mandate annual secure coding and privacy training for all developers and engineers.

controls.control_description: Require developers to produce security architecture and design documentation.

rules.text: Require data flow diagrams and threat models in design documents for new systems.

controls.control_description: Replace or mitigate unsupported system components to reduce risk.

rules.text: Identify and replace EOL/EOS components within 90 days of support end.

group_description: Mechanisms to protect system boundaries, communications, and data in transit and at rest from unauthorized access and modification.
group_purpose: Ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information through boundary defense, encryption, and secure protocols.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain system and communications protection policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal communications protection policy defining encryption, boundary, and protocol standards.
Document procedures for TLS configuration, firewall rules, and network segmentation.
Assign a network security lead responsible for boundary and encryption compliance.
Review and update comms protection policy annually or after major incidents.

controls.control_title: Separation of System and User Functionality
controls.control_description: Separate user functionality from system management functionality.

rules.text: Isolate management interfaces on dedicated OOB network or bastion hosts.
rules.tool: AWS Systems Manager, Azure Bastion, Jump Host

controls.control_description: Monitor, control, and protect communications at system boundaries.

rules.text: Deploy stateful firewalls at all external and internal trust boundaries.
rules.tool: AWS Network Firewall, Palo Alto, Azure Firewall

rules.text: Enforce deny-all default and explicitly allow only required ports and protocols.
Log and alert on all denied traffic and anomalous patterns at boundaries.

controls.control_description: Protect confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

rules.text: Enforce TLS 1.2 or higher with strong ciphers for all external communications.
rules.tool: AWS ALB, Azure App Gateway, Nginx

rules.text: Use IPsec or WireGuard VPN for all remote access and site-to-site connections.
rules.tool: AWS Site-to-Site VPN, Azure VPN Gateway

controls.control_description: Terminate network connections after inactivity or session end.

rules.text: Enforce 15-minute idle timeout on all interactive sessions and VPN connections.
rules.tool: AWS Client VPN, Azure AD, SSH Config

controls.control_description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys in accordance with standards.

rules.text: Use FIPS 140-validated KMS for all key storage, rotation, and access control.
rules.tool: AWS KMS, Azure Key Vault, GCP KMS

rules.text: Rotate encryption keys annually or upon key compromise.

controls.control_description: Implement approved cryptographic algorithms and modules.

rules.text: Use only FIPS-approved algorithms: AES-256, SHA-256, ECDSA P-384.

controls.control_description: Prohibit remote activation of collaborative devices unless explicitly authorized.

rules.text: Disable webcam and microphone by default; require approval for remote activation.

controls.control_description: Issue and manage PKI certificates for authentication and encryption.

rules.text: Issue short-lived certificates (≤90 days) via internal CA with automated renewal.

controls.control_description: Control use of mobile code and define acceptable technologies.

rules.text: Enforce strict CSP to allow only approved JavaScript sources and block inline scripts.

controls.control_description: Provide DNS data origin authentication and integrity verification.

rules.text: Enable DNSSEC signing and validation on all authoritative DNS zones.

controls.control_title: Secure Name/Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching)
controls.control_description: Secure recursive DNS resolvers with integrity and authentication.

rules.text: Enforce DNS over HTTPS (DoH) or TLS (DoT) with DNSSEC validation on all clients.

controls.control_title: Architecture and Provisioning for Name/Address Resolution Service
controls.control_description: Design DNS infrastructure for fault tolerance and attack resistance.

rules.text: Deploy DNS servers across multiple regions with anycast and rate limiting.

controls.control_description: Protect authenticity of communications sessions using cryptographic mechanisms.

rules.text: Enforce HSTS, Secure+HttpOnly cookies, and CSRF tokens on all web applications.

controls.control_description: Protect confidentiality and integrity of information at rest.

rules.text: Enable default encryption on all cloud storage and databases using AES-256.
rules.tool: AWS S3 SSE, RDS Encryption, Azure TDE

controls.control_description: Maintain a separate execution domain for each process.

rules.text: Run each application in isolated containers or VMs with restricted privileges.

controls.control_description: Control and monitor use of physical ports and I/O devices.

rules.text: Block all USB mass storage devices and allow only approved peripherals.

controls.control_description: Prohibit use of devices with unauthorized sensor capabilities.

rules.text: Disable cameras and microphones on managed devices in sensitive areas.

group_description: Mechanisms to identify, protect against, detect, and respond to flaws, malicious code, and unauthorized changes in systems and information.
group_purpose: Maintain trustworthiness of systems and data through timely flaw remediation, malware prevention, and integrity monitoring.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain system and information integrity policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal system integrity policy defining flaw remediation, malware defense, and monitoring.
Document procedures for patch management, antivirus updates, and file integrity checks.
Assign an integrity lead responsible for flaw tracking and malware response.
Review and update integrity policy annually or after major incidents.

controls.control_description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner.

rules.text: Patch critical vulnerabilities within 15 days and high within 30 days using automated tools.
Track all flaws in a central register with status, owner, and remediation date.
Test patches in staging before production deployment.

controls.control_description: Deploy malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points.

rules.text: Deploy EDR with real-time scanning and behavioral blocking on all endpoints and servers.
Update malware signatures daily and enable automatic quarantine of threats.
Scan all email attachments and web downloads at gateway and endpoint.

controls.control_description: Monitor systems to detect attacks, unauthorized activity, and system performance issues.

rules.text: Collect and correlate logs from all systems in a central SIEM with 24/7 monitoring.
Deploy IDS/IPS with automated alerts for suspicious network and host activity.
Monitor system performance and availability with thresholds and escalation.

controls.control_description: Receive and respond to security alerts and directives from authoritative sources.

rules.text: Subscribe to CISA, US-CERT, and vendor alerts with automated ingestion into ticketing.
Respond to critical alerts within 4 hours with investigation and remediation plan.

controls.control_description: Verify integrity of software, firmware, and information using cryptographic checks.

rules.text: Deploy FIM to monitor critical system files and alert on unauthorized changes.
Enforce code signing for all scripts, binaries, and container images.

controls.control_description: Deploy spam protection at email gateways and endpoints.

rules.text: Filter inbound and outbound email with AI-based spam and phishing detection.
Quarantine suspicious emails and require user release with warning banner.

controls.control_description: Validate inputs to protect against injection and malformed data attacks.

rules.text: Enforce server-side input validation, sanitization, and allow-listing in all applications.

controls.control_description: Handle errors to prevent information disclosure and maintain availability.

rules.text: Suppress detailed error messages in production; log internally without exposing stack traces.

controls.control_description: Manage and retain information in accordance with records retention policies.

rules.text: Retain security logs for 12 months and audit records per legal and business requirements.
rules.tool: S3 Glacier, Azure Blob Archive, ELK

controls.control_description: Implement memory protection to prevent exploitation of buffer overflows and injection.

rules.text: Enable ASLR, DEP, and stack canaries in OS and application runtimes.

controls.control_description: Design systems to fail securely in the event of operational failure.

rules.text: Configure systems to default to deny access and disable non-essential services on failure.

group_description: Strategies and processes to identify, assess, and mitigate risks in the supply chain for systems, components, and services.
group_purpose: Protect against counterfeit components, malicious insertion, and untrustworthy suppliers to ensure system integrity and availability.

controls.control_description: Develop, document, and maintain supply chain risk management policies and procedures.

rules.text: Create and maintain a formal supply chain risk management policy defining assessment, monitoring, and mitigation.
Document procedures for supplier vetting, SBOM validation, and incident response in supply chain.
Assign a supply chain risk officer responsible for program oversight and reporting.
Review and update supply chain policy annually or after major supplier changes.

controls.control_description: Develop and maintain a plan to manage supply chain risks throughout the system lifecycle.

rules.text: Develop a supply chain risk management plan with critical suppliers, risk thresholds, and mitigation strategies.
Include supplier diversity and alternative sourcing in plan to reduce single points of failure.

controls.control_description: Establish and implement controls to manage supply chain risks in acquisition and development.

rules.text: Require suppliers to provide SBOM in CycloneDX or SPDX format for all software and hardware.
Mandate tamper-evident packaging and chain-of-custody tracking for critical hardware.
Verify component provenance and authenticity using manufacturer certificates and secure boot.
rules.tool: UEFI Secure Boot, HSM, Intel SGX

controls.control_description: Assess and review suppliers for security, quality, and compliance before and during engagement.

rules.text: Conduct pre-engagement security assessment and require SOC 2 Type 2 or ISO 27001 certification.
Perform annual on-site or virtual audits of critical suppliers handling CUI or critical functions.

controls.control_description: Verify the integrity of supplied components using independent testing and validation.

rules.text: Validate firmware and software hashes against vendor-published golden images before deployment.
Use third-party labs to test critical components for backdoors and undocumented functionality.

controls.control_description: Use multiple suppliers to reduce dependency and mitigate supply chain disruption risks.

rules.text: Source critical components from at least two geographically diverse, qualified suppliers.

controls.control_description: Require suppliers to notify of changes, incidents, or vulnerabilities in supplied products.

rules.text: Include mandatory 48-hour notification clause for security incidents and product changes in contracts.
Subscribe to supplier PSIRT and vulnerability feeds with automated alerting.

controls.control_description: Develop and implement anti-counterfeit procedures and reporting mechanisms.

rules.text: Train procurement and IT staff to identify counterfeit indicators and report via hotline.
Use authorized distributors and verify certificates of conformance for all hardware purchases.
